title.narrative: Research for Development on Water Governance

description.narrative: The Mekong Region is changing rapidly, with complex and often competing drivers, including: demographic shifts, human development needs, energy and food security concerns, increasing investment and trade, deterioration of the natural environment, climate change and ever-changing geopolitics. These changes put pressures on natural resources especially water which has impact on social, environmental and economic and livelihoods of people in the region. Informed decision making is required to address these impacts. Funding under this investment supports the International Water Management Institute (IWMI) to work with local research institutes in the Mekong region to conduct research on water governance that will generate sound and scientific evedennce that will support informed decision making. The studies will: (a) examine how the benefits from the development of the region’s water resources can be better distributed amongst all stakeholders and its costs minimised; (b) improve the pract
